meta.title: Blender Method
meta.subtitle: The quick and effective way to prepare Kava – ideal for modern daily life.

overview.intro: The Blender Method is the modern alternative to the traditional kneading method. It is faster, less labor-intensive, and still provides a very good extraction.

alert.title: Ideal for...
alert.text: Beginners looking for an easy method, or experienced users who have little time. The Blender Method is also perfect for larger quantities.

essential.name: Filter Bag
essential.note: Nut milk bag or fine sieve

alert.title: Mixer Requirements
alert.text: Use a powerful stand mixer. Hand blenders or weak mixers do not extract effectively and can overheat. High-performance blenders like Vitamix or Blendtec are ideal.

items.title: Prepare Ingredients
details: Weigh Kava powder (20-40g depending on experience)
Measure water (400-600ml)
Prepare 1 tablespoon of coconut oil or coconut milk
Set aside filter bag and catching bowl
items.tip: The fat is particularly important in the Blender Method as it stabilizes the emulsion.

items.title: Add to Blender
items.description: Fill all ingredients into the stand mixer.
details: First, pour in the water (hand warm, 35-45°C)
Then add the Kava powder
Finally, add the fat (coconut oil/coconut milk)
Seal the lid tightly!
items.tip: Warm water improves extraction. Cold water works too, but is less effective.

items.title: Blend
items.description: Blend on the highest setting for maximum extraction.
details: Set the mixer to the highest setting
Blend continuously for 3-4 minutes
The mixture will become frothy and milky-brown
Take short breaks if overheating occurs
items.tip: Longer blending = stronger Kava. But be careful: some mixers overheat after 4+ minutes.

items.title: Filter
items.description: Pour the mixture through a filter bag.
details: Position the filter bag over a large bowl
Slowly pour in the blender mixture
Squeeze and wring out the bag
Press firmly several times until little liquid remains
items.tip: This step is important! Without filtering, you will drink coarse fibers that can cause nausea.

items.title: Serve
details: Pour into bowls or cups
Optional: Chill briefly in the refrigerator for cold Kava
Drink in one go ('Chug')
Have a chaser (fruit) ready
items.tip: Blender Kava may taste slightly more bitter than traditionally prepared Kava. A good chaser helps!

comparison.title: Comparison to Traditional Method
comparison.conclusion: Conclusion: The Blender Method is ideal for everyday use and beginners. For special occasions or maximum potency, the traditional method is preferable.

items.name: Ice Cube Trick
items.text: Add 2-3 ice cubes to the blender. This cools the mixture while blending and prevents overheating during longer blend times.

items.name: Double Filtering
items.text: Filter twice – first through a coarse bag, then through a fine bag. This results in a smoother Kava without sediment.

items.name: Lecithin Boost
items.text: A teaspoon of sunflower lecithin improves the emulsion and can increase the bioavailability of Kavalactones.

items.name: Batch Preparation
items.text: Prepare larger quantities and store the filtered Kava in the refrigerator. Keeps for 2-3 days. Shake well before drinking!

instant.title: Instant Kava
instant.subtitle: No effort, ready to drink immediately
